intro: Abildgaardia collina, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically has linear leaves and produces white or pinkish flowers in early summer. It thrives in harsh, well-drained soils and is often found in tundra and rocky habitats. Abildgaardia collina plays a role in stabilizing soil in its cold, high-altitude environments.

Abildgaardia collina is a small shrub that is well adapted to the harsh coastal conditions of its native habitat.
